segment.source: You can provide additional information about your app in the App declarations section of the App properties page during the submission process.
segment.target: You can provide additional information about your app in the App declarations section of the App properties page during the submission process.

segment.source: These declarations can help make sure your app is displayed appropriately and offered to the right set of customers, or can indicate how customers can use your app.
segment.target: These declarations can help make sure your app is displayed appropriately and offered to the right set of customers, or can indicate how customers can use your app.

segment.source: The following sections describe each declaration and what you need to consider when determining whether each declaration applies to your app.
segment.target: The following sections describe each declaration and what you need to consider when determining whether each declaration applies to your app.

segment.source: This app allows users to make purchases, but does not use the Windows Store commerce system.
segment.target: This app allows users to make purchases, but does not use the Windows Store commerce system.

segment.source: Most apps should leave this box unchecked, since apps which offer opportunities to make in-app purchases generally use the Microsoft in-app purchase API to create and submit the IAPs.
segment.target: Most apps should leave this box unchecked, since apps which offer opportunities to make in-app purchases generally use the Microsoft in-app purchase API to create and submit the IAPs.

segment.source: Per the App Developer Agreement, apps that were created and submitted prior to June 29, 2015, may continue to offer in-app purchasing functionality without using Microsoft's commerce engine, so long as the purchase functionality complies with the Windows Store Policies.
segment.target: Per the App Developer Agreement, apps that were created and submitted prior to June 29, 2015, may continue to offer in-app purchasing functionality without using Microsoft's commerce engine, so long as the purchase functionality complies with the Windows Store Policies.

segment.source: If this applies to your app, you must check this box.
segment.target: If this applies to your app, you must check this box.

segment.source: Otherwise, leave it unchecked.
segment.target: Otherwise, leave it unchecked.

segment.source: This app has been tested to meet accessibility guidelines.
segment.target: This app has been tested to meet accessibility guidelines.

segment.source: Checking this box makes your app discoverable to customers who are specifically looking for accessible apps in the Store.
segment.target: Checking this box makes your app discoverable to customers who are specifically looking for accessible apps in the Store.

segment.source: You should only check this box if you have done all of the following items:
segment.target: You should only check this box if you have done all of the following items:

segment.source: Set all the relevant accessibility info for UI elements, such as accessible names.
segment.target: Set all the relevant accessibility info for UI elements, such as accessible names.

segment.source: Implemented keyboard navigation and operations, taking into account tab order, keyboard activation, arrow keys navigation, shortcuts.
segment.target: Implemented keyboard navigation and operations, taking into account tab order, keyboard activation, arrow keys navigation, shortcuts.

segment.source: Ensured an accessible visual experience by including such things as a 4.5:1 text contrast ratio, and don't rely on color alone to convey info to the user.
segment.target: Ensured an accessible visual experience by including such things as a 4.5:1 text contrast ratio, and don't rely on color alone to convey info to the user.

segment.source: Used accessibility testing tools, such as Inspect or AccChecker, to verify your app, and resolve all high-priority errors detected by those tools.
segment.target: Used accessibility testing tools, such as Inspect or AccChecker, to verify your app, and resolve all high-priority errors detected by those tools.

segment.source: Verified the app’s key scenarios from end to end using such facilities and tools as Narrator, Magnifier, On Screen Keyboard, High Contrast, and High DPI.
segment.target: Verified the app’s key scenarios from end to end using such facilities and tools as Narrator, Magnifier, On Screen Keyboard, High Contrast, and High DPI.

segment.source: When you declare your app as accessible, you agree that your app is accessible to all customers, including those with disabilities.
segment.target: When you declare your app as accessible, you agree that your app is accessible to all customers, including those with disabilities.

segment.source: For example, this means you have tested the app with high-contrast mode and with a screen reader.
segment.target: For example, this means you have tested the app with high-contrast mode and with a screen reader.

segment.source: You've also verified that the user interface functions correctly with a keyboard, the Magnifier, and other accessibility tools.
segment.target: You've also verified that the user interface functions correctly with a keyboard, the Magnifier, and other accessibility tools.

segment.source: For more info, see Accessibility for Windows Runtime apps, Accessibility testing, and Accessibility in the Store.
segment.target: For more info, see Accessibility for Windows Runtime apps, Accessibility testing, and Accessibility in the Store.

segment.source: Important Don't list your app as accessible unless you have specifically engineered and tested it for that purpose.
segment.target: Important Don't list your app as accessible unless you have specifically engineered and tested it for that purpose.

segment.source: If your app is declared as accessible, but it doesn’t actually support accessibility, you'll probably receive negative feedback from the community.
segment.target: If your app is declared as accessible, but it doesn’t actually support accessibility, you'll probably receive negative feedback from the community.

segment.source: Customers can install this app to alternate drives or removable storage.
segment.target: Customers can install this app to alternate drives or removable storage.

segment.source: This box is checked by default, to allow customers to install your app to removable storage media such as an SD card, or to a non-system volume drive such as an external drive.
segment.target: This box is checked by default, to allow customers to install your app to removable storage media such as an SD card, or to a non-system volume drive such as an external drive.

segment.source: If you want to prevent your app from being installed to alternate drives or removable storage, uncheck this box.
segment.target: If you want to prevent your app from being installed to alternate drives or removable storage, uncheck this box.

segment.source: Note that there is no option to restrict installation so that an app can only be installed to removable storage media.
segment.target: Note that there is no option to restrict installation so that an app can only be installed to removable storage media.

segment.source: Windows can include this app's data in automatic backups to OneDrive.
segment.target: Windows can include this app's data in automatic backups to OneDrive.

segment.source: This box is checked by default, to allow your app's data to be included when a customer chooses to have Windows make automated backups to OneDrive.
segment.target: This box is checked by default, to allow your app's data to be included when a customer chooses to have Windows make automated backups to OneDrive.

segment.source: If you want to prevent your app's data from being included in automated backups, uncheck this box.
segment.target: If you want to prevent your app's data from being included in automated backups, uncheck this box.
